trans-unit.source: How to generate and transfer HSM-protected keys for Azure Key Vault | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to generate and transfer HSM-protected keys for Azure Key Vault | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use this article to help you plan for, generate, and then transfer your own HSM-protected keys to use with Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: Use this article to help you plan for, generate, and then transfer your own HSM-protected keys to use with Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: How to generate and transfer HSM-protected keys for Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: How to generate and transfer HSM-protected keys for Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: For added assurance, when you use Azure Key Vault, you can import or generate keys in hardware security modules (HSMs) that never leave the HSM boundary.
trans-unit.target: For added assurance, when you use Azure Key Vault, you can import or generate keys in hardware security modules (HSMs) that never leave the HSM boundary.

trans-unit.source: This scenario is often referred to as *bring your own key*, or BYOK.
trans-unit.target: This scenario is often referred to as *bring your own key*, or BYOK.

trans-unit.source: The HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.
trans-unit.target: The HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault uses Thales nShield family of HSMs to protect your keys.
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault uses Thales nShield family of HSMs to protect your keys.

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to help you plan for, generate and then transfer your own HSM-protected keys to use with Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to help you plan for, generate and then transfer your own HSM-protected keys to use with Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information about Azure Key Vault, see [What is Azure Key Vault?](key-vault-whatis.md)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For more information about Azure Key Vault, see [What is Azure Key Vault?](key-vault-whatis.md)

trans-unit.source: For a getting started tutorial, which includes creating a key vault for HSM-protected keys, see [Get started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For a getting started tutorial, which includes creating a key vault for HSM-protected keys, see [Get started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: More information about generating and transferring an HSM-protected key over the Internet:
trans-unit.target: More information about generating and transferring an HSM-protected key over the Internet:

trans-unit.source: You generate the key from an offline workstation, which reduces the attack surface.
trans-unit.target: You generate the key from an offline workstation, which reduces the attack surface.

trans-unit.source: The key is encrypted with a Key Exchange Key (KEK), which stays encrypted until it is transferred to the Azure Key Vault HSMs.
trans-unit.target: The key is encrypted with a Key Exchange Key (KEK), which stays encrypted until it is transferred to the Azure Key Vault HSMs.

trans-unit.source: Only the encrypted version of your key leaves the original workstation.
trans-unit.target: Only the encrypted version of your key leaves the original workstation.

trans-unit.source: The toolset sets properties on your tenant key that binds your key to the Azure Key Vault security world.
trans-unit.target: The toolset sets properties on your tenant key that binds your key to the Azure Key Vault security world.

trans-unit.source: So after the Azure Key Vault HSMs receive and decrypt your key, only these HSMs can use it.
trans-unit.target: So after the Azure Key Vault HSMs receive and decrypt your key, only these HSMs can use it.

trans-unit.source: Your key cannot be exported.
trans-unit.target: Your key cannot be exported.

trans-unit.source: This binding is enforced by the Thales HSMs.
trans-unit.target: This binding is enforced by the Thales HSMs.

trans-unit.source: The Key Exchange Key (KEK) that is used to encrypt your key is generated inside the Azure Key Vault HSMs and is not exportable.
trans-unit.target: The Key Exchange Key (KEK) that is used to encrypt your key is generated inside the Azure Key Vault HSMs and is not exportable.

trans-unit.source: The HSMs enforce that there can be no clear version of the KEK outside the HSMs.
trans-unit.target: The HSMs enforce that there can be no clear version of the KEK outside the HSMs.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the toolset includes attestation from Thales that the KEK is not exportable and was generated inside a genuine HSM that was manufactured by Thales.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the toolset includes attestation from Thales that the KEK is not exportable and was generated inside a genuine HSM that was manufactured by Thales.

trans-unit.source: The toolset includes attestation from Thales that the Azure Key Vault security world was also generated on a genuine HSM manufactured by Thales.
trans-unit.target: The toolset includes attestation from Thales that the Azure Key Vault security world was also generated on a genuine HSM manufactured by Thales.

trans-unit.source: This proves to you that Microsoft is using genuine hardware.
trans-unit.target: This proves to you that Microsoft is using genuine hardware.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft uses separate KEKs as well as separate Security Worlds in each geographical region, which ensures that your key can be used only in data centers in the region in which you encrypted it.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft uses separate KEKs as well as separate Security Worlds in each geographical region, which ensures that your key can be used only in data centers in the region in which you encrypted it.

trans-unit.source: For example, a key from a European customer cannot be used in data centers in North American or Asia.
trans-unit.target: For example, a key from a European customer cannot be used in data centers in North American or Asia.

trans-unit.source: More information about Thales HSMs and Microsoft services
trans-unit.target: More information about Thales HSMs and Microsoft services

trans-unit.source: Thales e-Security is a leading global provider of data encryption and cyber security solutions to the financial services, high technology, manufacturing, government, and technology sectors.
trans-unit.target: Thales e-Security is a leading global provider of data encryption and cyber security solutions to the financial services, high technology, manufacturing, government, and technology sectors.

trans-unit.source: With a 40-year track record of protecting corporate and government information, Thales solutions are used by four of the five largest energy and aerospace companies, 22 NATO countries, and secure more than 80 per cent of worldwide payment transactions.
trans-unit.target: With a 40-year track record of protecting corporate and government information, Thales solutions are used by four of the five largest energy and aerospace companies, 22 NATO countries, and secure more than 80 per cent of worldwide payment transactions.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft has collaborated with Thales to enhance the state of art for HSMs.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft has collaborated with Thales to enhance the state of art for HSMs.

trans-unit.source: These enhancements enable you to get the typical benefits of hosted services without relinquishing control over your keys.
trans-unit.target: These enhancements enable you to get the typical benefits of hosted services without relinquishing control over your keys.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, these enhancements let Microsoft manage the HSMs so that you do not have to.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, these enhancements let Microsoft manage the HSMs so that you do not have to.

trans-unit.source: As a cloud service, Azure Key Vault scales up at short notice to meet your organization’s usage spikes.
trans-unit.target: As a cloud service, Azure Key Vault scales up at short notice to meet your organization’s usage spikes.

trans-unit.source: At the same time, your key is protected inside Microsoft’s HSMs: You retain control over the key lifecycle because you generate the key and transfer it to Microsoft’s HSMs.
trans-unit.target: At the same time, your key is protected inside Microsoft’s HSMs: You retain control over the key lifecycle because you generate the key and transfer it to Microsoft’s HSMs.

trans-unit.source: Implementing bring your own key (BYOK) for Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Implementing bring your own key (BYOK) for Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Use the following information and procedures if you will generate your own HSM-protected key and then transfer it to Azure Key Vault—the bring your own key (BYOK) scenario.
trans-unit.target: Use the following information and procedures if you will generate your own HSM-protected key and then transfer it to Azure Key Vault—the bring your own key (BYOK) scenario.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for BYOK
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for BYOK

trans-unit.source: See the following table for a list of prerequisites for bring your own key (BYOK) for Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: See the following table for a list of prerequisites for bring your own key (BYOK) for Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: A subscription to Azure
trans-unit.target: A subscription to Azure

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Key Vault, you need an Azure subscription: [Sign up for free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/)
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Key Vault, you need an Azure subscription: [Sign up for free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/)

trans-unit.source: An Azure Key Vault that supports HSMs
trans-unit.target: An Azure Key Vault that supports HSMs

trans-unit.source: For more information about the service tiers and capabilities for Azure Key Vault, see the [Azure Key Vault Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/key-vault/) website.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the service tiers and capabilities for Azure Key Vault, see the [Azure Key Vault Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/key-vault/) website.

trans-unit.source: Thales HSM, smartcards, and support software
trans-unit.target: Thales HSM, smartcards, and support software

trans-unit.source: You must have access to a Thales Hardware Security Module and basic operational knowledge of Thales HSMs.
trans-unit.target: You must have access to a Thales Hardware Security Module and basic operational knowledge of Thales HSMs.

trans-unit.source: See [Thales Hardware Security Module](https://www.thales-esecurity.com/msrms/buy) for the list of compatible models, or to purchase an HSM if you do not have one.
trans-unit.target: See [Thales Hardware Security Module](https://www.thales-esecurity.com/msrms/buy) for the list of compatible models, or to purchase an HSM if you do not have one.

trans-unit.source: The following hardware and software:
trans-unit.target: The following hardware and software:

trans-unit.source: An offline x64 workstation with a minimum Windows operation system of Windows 7 and Thales nShield software that is at least version 11.50.
trans-unit.target: An offline x64 workstation with a minimum Windows operation system of Windows 7 and Thales nShield software that is at least version 11.50.

trans-unit.source: If this workstation runs Windows 7, you must [install Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5](http://download.microsoft.com/download/b/a/4/ba4a7e71-2906-4b2d-a0e1-80cf16844f5f/dotnetfx45_full_x86_x64.exe).
trans-unit.target: If this workstation runs Windows 7, you must [install Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5](http://download.microsoft.com/download/b/a/4/ba4a7e71-2906-4b2d-a0e1-80cf16844f5f/dotnetfx45_full_x86_x64.exe).

trans-unit.source: A workstation that is connected to the Internet and has a minimum Windows operation system of Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: A workstation that is connected to the Internet and has a minimum Windows operation system of Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: A USB drive or other portable storage device that has at least 16 MB free space.
trans-unit.target: A USB drive or other portable storage device that has at least 16 MB free space.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, we recommend that the first workstation is not connected to a network.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, we recommend that the first workstation is not connected to a network.

trans-unit.source: However, this is not programmatically enforced.
trans-unit.target: However, this is not programmatically enforced.

trans-unit.source: Note that in the instructions that follow, this workstation is referred to as the disconnected workstation.
trans-unit.target: Note that in the instructions that follow, this workstation is referred to as the disconnected workstation.

trans-unit.source: In addition, if your tenant key is for a production network, we recommend that you use a second, separate workstation to download the toolset and upload the tenant key.
trans-unit.target: In addition, if your tenant key is for a production network, we recommend that you use a second, separate workstation to download the toolset and upload the tenant key.

trans-unit.source: But for testing purposes, you can use the same workstation as the first one.
trans-unit.target: But for testing purposes, you can use the same workstation as the first one.

trans-unit.source: Note that in the instructions that follow, this second workstation is referred to as the Internet-connected workstation.
trans-unit.target: Note that in the instructions that follow, this second workstation is referred to as the Internet-connected workstation.

trans-unit.source: Generate and transfer your key to Azure Key Vault HSM
trans-unit.target: Generate and transfer your key to Azure Key Vault HSM

trans-unit.source: You will use the following 5 steps to generate and transfer your key to an Azure Key Vault HSM:
trans-unit.target: You will use the following 5 steps to generate and transfer your key to an Azure Key Vault HSM:

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Prepare your Internet-connected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Prepare your Internet-connected workstation

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Prepare your disconnected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Prepare your disconnected workstation

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Generate your key
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Generate your key

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Prepare your key for transfer
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Prepare your key for transfer

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Transfer your key to Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Transfer your key to Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Prepare your Internet-connected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Prepare your Internet-connected workstation

trans-unit.source: For this first step, do the following procedures on your workstation that is connected to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: For this first step, do the following procedures on your workstation that is connected to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.1: Install Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Step 1.1: Install Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: From the Internet-connected workstation, download and install the Azure PowerShell module that includes the cmdlets to manage Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: From the Internet-connected workstation, download and install the Azure PowerShell module that includes the cmdlets to manage Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: This requires a minimum version of 0.8.13.
trans-unit.target: This requires a minimum version of 0.8.13.

trans-unit.source: For installation instructions, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For installation instructions, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 1.2: Get your Azure subscription ID
trans-unit.target: Step 1.2: Get your Azure subscription ID

trans-unit.source: Start an Azure PowerShell session and sign in to your Azure account by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Start an Azure PowerShell session and sign in to your Azure account by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up browser window, enter your Azure account user name and password.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up browser window, enter your Azure account user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the [Get-AzureSubscription](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790366.aspx) command:
trans-unit.target: Then, use the [Get-AzureSubscription](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790366.aspx) command:

trans-unit.source: From the output, locate the ID for the subscription you will use for Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: From the output, locate the ID for the subscription you will use for Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: You will need this subscription ID later.
trans-unit.target: You will need this subscription ID later.

trans-unit.source: Do not close the Azure PowerShell window.
trans-unit.target: Do not close the Azure PowerShell window.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.3: Download the BYOK toolset for Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Step 1.3: Download the BYOK toolset for Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Go to the Microsoft Download Center and [download the Azure Key Vault BYOK toolset](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=45345) for your region:
trans-unit.target: Go to the Microsoft Download Center and [download the Azure Key Vault BYOK toolset](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=45345) for your region:

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Package name
trans-unit.target: Package name

trans-unit.source: SHA-256 package hash
trans-unit.target: SHA-256 package hash

trans-unit.source: North America
trans-unit.target: North America

trans-unit.source: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-UnitedStates.zip
trans-unit.target: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-UnitedStates.zip

trans-unit.source: D9FDA9F5A34E1388CD6C9138E5B75B7051FB7D6B11F087AFE0553DC85CCF0E36
trans-unit.target: D9FDA9F5A34E1388CD6C9138E5B75B7051FB7D6B11F087AFE0553DC85CCF0E36

trans-unit.source: Europe
trans-unit.target: Europe

trans-unit.source: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-Europe.zip
trans-unit.target: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-Europe.zip

trans-unit.source: Asia
trans-unit.target: Asia

trans-unit.source: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-AsiaPacific.zip
trans-unit.target: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-AsiaPacific.zip

trans-unit.source: Latin America
trans-unit.target: Latin America

trans-unit.source: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-LatinAmerica.zip
trans-unit.target: KeyVault-BYOK-Tools-LatinAmerica.zip

trans-unit.source: To validate the integrity of your downloaded BYOK toolset, from your Azure PowerShell session, use the [Get-FileHash](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn520872.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To validate the integrity of your downloaded BYOK toolset, from your Azure PowerShell session, use the [Get-FileHash](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn520872.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The toolset includes the following:
trans-unit.target: The toolset includes the following:

trans-unit.source: A Key Exchange Key (KEK) package that has a name beginning with **BYOK-KEK-pkg-.**
trans-unit.target: A Key Exchange Key (KEK) package that has a name beginning with **BYOK-KEK-pkg-.**

trans-unit.source: A Security World package that has a name beginning with **BYOK-SecurityWorld-pkg-.**
trans-unit.target: A Security World package that has a name beginning with **BYOK-SecurityWorld-pkg-.**

trans-unit.source: A python script named v**erifykeypackage.py.**
trans-unit.target: A python script named v**erifykeypackage.py.**

trans-unit.source: A command-line executable file named **KeyTransferRemote.exe** and associated DLLs.
trans-unit.target: A command-line executable file named **KeyTransferRemote.exe** and associated DLLs.

trans-unit.source: A Visual C++ Redistributable Package, named **vcredist_x64.exe.**
trans-unit.target: A Visual C++ Redistributable Package, named **vcredist_x64.exe.**

trans-unit.source: Copy the package to a USB drive or other portable storage.
trans-unit.target: Copy the package to a USB drive or other portable storage.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Prepare your disconnected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Prepare your disconnected workstation

trans-unit.source: For this second step, do the following procedures on the workstation that is not connected to a network (either the Internet or your internal network).
trans-unit.target: For this second step, do the following procedures on the workstation that is not connected to a network (either the Internet or your internal network).

trans-unit.source: Step 2.1: Prepare the disconnected workstation with Thales HSM
trans-unit.target: Step 2.1: Prepare the disconnected workstation with Thales HSM

trans-unit.source: Install the nCipher (Thales) support software on a Windows computer, and then attach a Thales HSM to that computer.
trans-unit.target: Install the nCipher (Thales) support software on a Windows computer, and then attach a Thales HSM to that computer.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Thales tools are in your path (**%nfast_home%\bin** and **%nfast_home%\python\bin**).
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the Thales tools are in your path (**%nfast_home%\bin** and **%nfast_home%\python\bin**).

trans-unit.source: For example, type the following:
trans-unit.target: For example, type the following:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the user guide included with the Thales HSM.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the user guide included with the Thales HSM.

trans-unit.source: Step 2.2: Install the BYOK toolset on the disconnected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 2.2: Install the BYOK toolset on the disconnected workstation

trans-unit.source: Copy the BYOK toolset package from the USB drive or other portable storage, and then do the following:
trans-unit.target: Copy the BYOK toolset package from the USB drive or other portable storage, and then do the following:

trans-unit.source: Extract the files from the downloaded package into any folder.
trans-unit.target: Extract the files from the downloaded package into any folder.

trans-unit.source: From that folder, run vcredist_x64.exe.
trans-unit.target: From that folder, run vcredist_x64.exe.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions to the install the Visual C++ runtime components for Visual Studio 2012.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions to the install the Visual C++ runtime components for Visual Studio 2012.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Generate your key
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Generate your key

trans-unit.source: For this third step, do the following procedures on the disconnected workstation.
trans-unit.target: For this third step, do the following procedures on the disconnected workstation.

trans-unit.source: Step 3.1: Create a security world
trans-unit.target: Step 3.1: Create a security world

trans-unit.source: Start a command prompt and run the Thales new-world program.
trans-unit.target: Start a command prompt and run the Thales new-world program.

trans-unit.source: This program creates a **Security World** file at %NFAST_KMDATA%\local\world, which corresponds to the C:\ProgramData\nCipher\Key Management Data\local folder.
trans-unit.target: This program creates a **Security World** file at %NFAST_KMDATA%\local\world, which corresponds to the C:\ProgramData\nCipher\Key Management Data\local folder.

trans-unit.source: You can use different values for the quorum but in our example, you’re prompted to enter three blank cards and pins for each one.
trans-unit.target: You can use different values for the quorum but in our example, you’re prompted to enter three blank cards and pins for each one.

trans-unit.source: Then, any two cards will give full access to the security world.
trans-unit.target: Then, any two cards will give full access to the security world.

trans-unit.source: These cards become the **Administrator Card Set** for the new security world.
trans-unit.target: These cards become the **Administrator Card Set** for the new security world.

trans-unit.source: Then do the following:
trans-unit.target: Then do the following:

trans-unit.source: Back up the world file.
trans-unit.target: Back up the world file.

trans-unit.source: Secure and protect the world file, the Administrator Cards, and their pins, and make sure that no single person has access to more than one card.
trans-unit.target: Secure and protect the world file, the Administrator Cards, and their pins, and make sure that no single person has access to more than one card.

trans-unit.source: Step 3.2: Validate the downloaded package
trans-unit.target: Step 3.2: Validate the downloaded package

trans-unit.source: This step is optional but recommended so that you can validate the following:
trans-unit.target: This step is optional but recommended so that you can validate the following:

trans-unit.source: The Key Exchange Key that is included in the toolset has been generated from a genuine Thales HSM.
trans-unit.target: The Key Exchange Key that is included in the toolset has been generated from a genuine Thales HSM.

trans-unit.source: The hash of the Security World that is included in the toolset has been generated in a genuine Thales HSM.
trans-unit.target: The hash of the Security World that is included in the toolset has been generated in a genuine Thales HSM.

trans-unit.source: The Key Exchange Key is non-exportable.
trans-unit.target: The Key Exchange Key is non-exportable.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To validate the downloaded package, the HSM must be connected, powered on, and must have a security world on it (such as the one you’ve just created).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To validate the downloaded package, the HSM must be connected, powered on, and must have a security world on it (such as the one you’ve just created).

trans-unit.source: To validate the downloaded package:
trans-unit.target: To validate the downloaded package:

trans-unit.source: Run the verifykeypackage.py script by tying one of the following, depending on your region:
trans-unit.target: Run the verifykeypackage.py script by tying one of the following, depending on your region:

trans-unit.source: For North America:
trans-unit.target: For North America:

trans-unit.source: For Europe:
trans-unit.target: For Europe:

trans-unit.source: For Asia:
trans-unit.target: For Asia:

trans-unit.source: For Latin America:
trans-unit.target: For Latin America:

trans-unit.source: For Japan:
trans-unit.target: For Japan:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]The Thales software includes python at %NFAST_HOME%\python\bin
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]The Thales software includes python at %NFAST_HOME%\python\bin

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see the following, which indicates successful validation: **Result: SUCCESS**
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see the following, which indicates successful validation: **Result: SUCCESS**

trans-unit.source: This script validates the signer chain up to the Thales root key.
trans-unit.target: This script validates the signer chain up to the Thales root key.

trans-unit.source: The hash of this root key is embedded in the script and its value should be **59178a47 de508c3f 291277ee 184f46c4 f1d9c639**.
trans-unit.target: The hash of this root key is embedded in the script and its value should be **59178a47 de508c3f 291277ee 184f46c4 f1d9c639**.

trans-unit.source: You can also confirm this value separately by visiting the [Thales website](http://www.thalesesec.com/).
trans-unit.target: You can also confirm this value separately by visiting the [Thales website](http://www.thalesesec.com/).

trans-unit.source: You’re now ready to create a new key.
trans-unit.target: You’re now ready to create a new key.

trans-unit.source: Step 3.3: Create a new key
trans-unit.target: Step 3.3: Create a new key

trans-unit.source: Generate a key by using the Thales **generatekey** program.
trans-unit.target: Generate a key by using the Thales **generatekey** program.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to generate the key:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to generate the key:

trans-unit.source: When you run this command, use these instructions:
trans-unit.target: When you run this command, use these instructions:

trans-unit.source: Replace the value of *contosokey* for the **ident** and **plainname** with any string value.
trans-unit.target: Replace the value of *contosokey* for the **ident** and **plainname** with any string value.

trans-unit.source: To minimize administrative overheads and reduce the risk of errors, we recommend that you use the same value for both.
trans-unit.target: To minimize administrative overheads and reduce the risk of errors, we recommend that you use the same value for both.

trans-unit.source: The **ident** value must contain only numbers, dashes, and lower case letters.
trans-unit.target: The **ident** value must contain only numbers, dashes, and lower case letters.

trans-unit.source: The pubexp is left blank (default) in this example, but you can specify specific values.
trans-unit.target: The pubexp is left blank (default) in this example, but you can specify specific values.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the Thales documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the Thales documentation.

trans-unit.source: This command creates a Tokenized Key file in your %NFAST_KMDATA%\local folder with a name starting with **key_simple_** followed by the ident that was specified in the command.
trans-unit.target: This command creates a Tokenized Key file in your %NFAST_KMDATA%\local folder with a name starting with **key_simple_** followed by the ident that was specified in the command.

trans-unit.source: For example: **key_simple_contosokey**.
trans-unit.target: For example: **key_simple_contosokey**.

trans-unit.source: This file contains an encrypted key.
trans-unit.target: This file contains an encrypted key.

trans-unit.source: Back up this Tokenized Key File in a safe location.
trans-unit.target: Back up this Tokenized Key File in a safe location.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you later transfer your key to Azure Key Vault, Microsoft cannot export this key back to you so it becomes extremely important that you back up your key and security world safely.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you later transfer your key to Azure Key Vault, Microsoft cannot export this key back to you so it becomes extremely important that you back up your key and security world safely.

trans-unit.source: Contact Thales for guidance and best practices for backing up your key.
trans-unit.target: Contact Thales for guidance and best practices for backing up your key.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to transfer your key to Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to transfer your key to Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Prepare your key for transfer
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Prepare your key for transfer

trans-unit.source: For this fourth step, do the following procedures on the disconnected workstation.
trans-unit.target: For this fourth step, do the following procedures on the disconnected workstation.

trans-unit.source: Step 4.1: Create a copy of your key with reduced permissions
trans-unit.target: Step 4.1: Create a copy of your key with reduced permissions

trans-unit.source: To reduce the permissions on your key, from a command prompt, run one of the following, depending on your region:
trans-unit.target: To reduce the permissions on your key, from a command prompt, run one of the following, depending on your region:

trans-unit.source: For North America:
trans-unit.target: For North America:

trans-unit.source: For Europe:
trans-unit.target: For Europe:

trans-unit.source: For Asia:
trans-unit.target: For Asia:

trans-unit.source: For Latin America:
trans-unit.target: For Latin America:

trans-unit.source: For Japan:
trans-unit.target: For Japan:

trans-unit.source: When you run this command, replace *contosokey* with the same value you specified in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.
trans-unit.target: When you run this command, replace *contosokey* with the same value you specified in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked to plug in your security world admin cards.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked to plug in your security world admin cards.

trans-unit.source: When the command completes, you will see **Result: SUCCESS** and the copy of your key with reduced permissions will be in the file named key_xferacId_
trans-unit.target: When the command completes, you will see **Result: SUCCESS** and the copy of your key with reduced permissions will be in the file named key_xferacId_

trans-unit.source: Step 4.2: Inspect the new copy of the key
trans-unit.target: Step 4.2: Inspect the new copy of the key

trans-unit.source: Optionally, run the Thales utilities to confirm the minimal permissions on the new key:
trans-unit.target: Optionally, run the Thales utilities to confirm the minimal permissions on the new key:

trans-unit.source: aclprint.py:
trans-unit.target: aclprint.py:

trans-unit.source: kmfile-dump.exe:
trans-unit.target: kmfile-dump.exe:

trans-unit.source: When you run these command, replace contosokey with the same value you specified in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.
trans-unit.target: When you run these command, replace contosokey with the same value you specified in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.

trans-unit.source: Step 4.3: Encrypt your key by using Microsoft’s Key Exchange Key
trans-unit.target: Step 4.3: Encrypt your key by using Microsoft’s Key Exchange Key

trans-unit.source: Run one of the following commands, depending on your region:
trans-unit.target: Run one of the following commands, depending on your region:

trans-unit.source: For North America:
trans-unit.target: For North America:

trans-unit.source: For Europe:
trans-unit.target: For Europe:

trans-unit.source: For Asia:
trans-unit.target: For Asia:

trans-unit.source: For Latin America:
trans-unit.target: For Latin America:

trans-unit.source: For Japan:
trans-unit.target: For Japan:

trans-unit.source: When you run this command, use these instructions:
trans-unit.target: When you run this command, use these instructions:

trans-unit.source: Replace *contosokey* with the identifier that you used to generate the key in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.
trans-unit.target: Replace *contosokey* with the identifier that you used to generate the key in **Step 3.3: Create a new key** from the [Generate your key](#step-3-generate-your-key) step.

trans-unit.source: Replace *SubscriptionID* with the ID of the Azure subscription that contains your key vault.
trans-unit.target: Replace *SubscriptionID* with the ID of the Azure subscription that contains your key vault.

trans-unit.source: You retrieved this value previously, in **Step 1.2: Get your Azure subscription ID** from the [Prepare your Internet-connected workstation](#step-1-prepare-your-internet-connected-workstation) step.
trans-unit.target: You retrieved this value previously, in **Step 1.2: Get your Azure subscription ID** from the [Prepare your Internet-connected workstation](#step-1-prepare-your-internet-connected-workstation) step.

trans-unit.source: Replace *ContosoFirstHSMKey* with a label that will be used for your output file name.
trans-unit.target: Replace *ContosoFirstHSMKey* with a label that will be used for your output file name.

trans-unit.source: When this completes successfully it displays **Result: SUCCESS** and there will be a new file in the current folder that has the following name: TransferPackage-*ContosoFirstHSMkey*.byok
trans-unit.target: When this completes successfully it displays **Result: SUCCESS** and there will be a new file in the current folder that has the following name: TransferPackage-*ContosoFirstHSMkey*.byok

trans-unit.source: Step 4.4: Copy your key transfer package to the Internet-connected workstation
trans-unit.target: Step 4.4: Copy your key transfer package to the Internet-connected workstation

trans-unit.source: Use a USB drive or other portable storage to copy the output file from the previous step (KeyTransferPackage-ContosoFirstHSMkey.byok) to your Internet-connected workstation.
trans-unit.target: Use a USB drive or other portable storage to copy the output file from the previous step (KeyTransferPackage-ContosoFirstHSMkey.byok) to your Internet-connected workstation.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Transfer your key to Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Transfer your key to Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: For this final step, on the Internet-connected workstation, use the [Add-AzureKeyVaultKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn868048.aspx) cmdlet to upload the key transfer package that you copied from the disconnected workstation to the Azure Key Vault HSM:
trans-unit.target: For this final step, on the Internet-connected workstation, use the [Add-AzureKeyVaultKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn868048.aspx) cmdlet to upload the key transfer package that you copied from the disconnected workstation to the Azure Key Vault HSM:

trans-unit.source: If the upload is successful, you see displayed the properties of the key that you just added.
trans-unit.target: If the upload is successful, you see displayed the properties of the key that you just added.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can now use this HSM-protected key in your key vault.
trans-unit.target: You can now use this HSM-protected key in your key vault.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the **If you want to use a hardware security module (HSM)** section in the [Getting started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md) tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the **If you want to use a hardware security module (HSM)** section in the [Getting started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md) tutorial.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
